text: Scriptures describe the appearance of Brahmaji thus:
CHATURMUKHD VEDADHARAH SAKSHASUTRA KAMANDALUH | HANSARUDHO RAKTAVASA BRAHMALOKA PITAMAH || Meaning:
He has four heads, holds Vedas, Rosary, Yagyopavita (Sacred thread) and Kamandalu (bowl);
wears red cothes and rides a swan.
He is none other than Brahmaji, grandfather of all of us.
title: Scriptural Appearance of Brahmaji
